title: IITians and Modesty: A Humorous Debate on X
description: The IITian's humorous post about the modesty of IIT alumni has sparked conversation on X, drawing attention from users including author Ankur Warikoo. Warikoo chimed in with a story about an unassuming IIT graduate working at Hindustan Unilever (HUL) who left a lasting impression on him, further fueling the discussion.
news:
A recent post on X sparked a debate about the modesty of IIT alumni. IIT Roorkee graduate Jay Modi (@jay_modi6) shared a story of a man who downplayed his IIT Kanpur background, leading Modi to jokingly call IITians the "most modest creatures out there." This humorous observation resonated with users who shared their own experiences with unassuming IIT graduates.

Author Ankur Warikoo joined the conversation with a story about a seemingly ordinary young man he met on a flight. The man, an IIT and IIM graduate working at Hindustan Unilever, never bragged about his prestigious background, leaving Warikoo initially assuming he was from a smaller company. This encounter highlighted the potential for assumptions to cloud our perceptions and underscored the idea of modesty in the face of accomplishment. 

However, other users pointed out that not all IITians are equally modest, with some noting that those who chose less sought-after branches might be more likely to downplay their IIT affiliation. Ultimately, the debate highlights the complexity of modesty and the potential for both humor and introspection when discussing educational achievements.

title: Hyderabad Cop's Lamborghini Encounter Goes Viral
description: The officer, clearly thrilled, hesitated at first, admitting he wasn’t sure how to enter such a high-end vehicle. He even asked a fellow officer to snap a photo, capturing the light-hearted moment.
news:
A routine traffic stop in Hyderabad took a lighthearted turn when a police officer was invited to sit inside a Lamborghini by its owner, entrepreneur Nishant Saboo. The officer, clearly excited by the opportunity, hesitated initially, unsure how to enter the luxury vehicle.  He even asked a fellow officer to take a picture, capturing the moment.

Saboo shared the video on his Instagram account, garnering over three million views and positive reactions from viewers who praised the officer's enthusiasm and Saboo's kindness.  One commenter joked, "The officer didn't even know how to get in."

Saboo is known for his love of luxury cars and frequently posts about them on his platform, SuperCarsCommunity_India.  This latest incident highlights the joy that car enthusiasts can find in sharing their passion, even with those outside their usual circles.

title: Global Food Prices Rise, Worrying India's Central Bank
description: According to its latest data , the FFPI stood at 124.4 points in September 2024, up 3 percent from August and marking the largest month-on-month increase since March 2022.
news:
The FAO Food Price Index (FFPI) surged 3% in September 2024, marking the largest monthly increase since March 2022. This sharp rise has put India's Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on high alert. 

The FFPI, which tracks international food commodity prices, has been steadily increasing since January 2024. The ongoing Israel-West Asia conflict has exacerbated the situation, disrupting global supply chains and pushing prices higher. This is particularly worrying for India, which heavily relies on imports for key food commodities like vegetable oils and wheat.

The recent spike in the FFPI threatens India's inflation management strategy, which is already grappling with a projected rise in Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation to 4.7% in the October-December quarter. The RBI had previously anticipated a decline in global food prices, allowing for a more accommodative monetary policy. However, the current trend necessitates a re-evaluation of that stance.

The upcoming RBI Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meeting will be closely watched for any changes to its inflation projections and interest rate policy in light of this global development.

title: "I'm Called Useless":  Government Bank Employee Overwhelmed by Constant Target Pressure
description: He described the constant barrage of calls from superiors, demanding updates on targets and performance. The relentless pressure, coupled with long working hours and a lack of work-life balance, has taken a toll on their mental and physical health.
news:
An anonymous employee of a government bank in India has spoken out about the intense pressure he faces daily,  receiving up to 35 calls a day from superiors demanding performance updates. He describes the constant pressure as akin to working in a call center, impacting his mental and physical health.  He also alleges that many of these calls focus on his perceived failure to meet targets, leading him to feel demoralized. 

This is not an isolated case. In May, a video went viral of a Canara Bank manager berating employees during a Zoom meeting, emphasizing that their primary focus should be the bank, even at the expense of personal life. 

The employee, a manager in his 30s, describes his daily duties, which include managing HNI accounts, overseeing operations, promoting financial products, and handling legacy loan cases,  including attending court hearings and calling borrowers.  The relentless pressure from superiors and the constant demands for performance improvement are taking a toll on his well-being.

news:
Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali has been in the news recently, discussing his childhood, his creative process, and even shedding light on the personal life of his colleague, Vidhu Vinod Chopra. 

In a recent interview, Bhansali revealed that Chopra's first wife had a significant impact on his career path. Bhansali said, "Vidhu Vinod Chopra's first wife, who is no more, she forced him to make 'Parinda' in 1989. That film was very emotional. That film is very important to me because it made me think of making films like that, where the audience gets emotionally involved." 

While Bhansali didn't elaborate on the specific details of the wife's influence, his statement highlights the powerful role personal experiences can play in shaping creative decisions and artistic expression.

title: One Year Later: Online Gaming Companies Push for GST Review
description: One year on, 28% GST review remains top of wish list for online gaming companies
news:
One year after India implemented a 28% Goods and Services Tax (GST) on online gaming, the industry is calling for a review of the rate. While companies like A23 have adapted to the new tax regime, they argue that the high rate has significantly impacted their profitability.

Deepak Gullapalli, CEO of A23, noted that while they collect GST from customers, the burden ultimately falls on the company. This has led to a significant reduction in margins, with A23 now operating at close to zero profit.

Gullapalli expressed hope that the government will consider a review, citing the industry's commitment to responsible gaming and self-regulation. He believes that whitelisting legitimate gaming platforms would benefit both consumers and the industry.

The online gaming industry is seeking a dialogue with the government to address the impact of the 28% GST, hoping for a rate reduction or other measures to support the sector's growth.

title: Indian Firms Accused of Sending ₹50,000 Crore to China via Hawala
description: Several Indian firms are suspected of having violated laws by under-invoicing luxury products such as furniture and gadgets imported from Beijing
news:
The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating allegations of money laundering involving Indian companies importing goods from China. These companies are suspected of under-invoicing luxury products like furniture and gadgets, allowing them to evade taxes and transfer the remaining payments to Chinese sellers through hawala networks.

Officials claim that Indian firms have siphoned off an estimated ₹50,000 crore to China through this practice in the last six months alone. This suspected activity violates both anti-money laundering and foreign exchange regulations.

The ED has launched a formal investigation under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) to uncover how the funds are rerouted to China and whether cryptocurrencies are used in these transactions.  

This crackdown is part of a broader government effort to control illegal financial flows and strengthen India's economic security. The investigation is expected to expand as the ED tracks the alleged misuse of funds and examines financial activities related to Chinese imports.

title: India's Economic Growth Slowing Down: Signals of a Slump
description: High-frequency indicators suggest a slowdown in the pace of India’s economic growth, from capex to core sector data – weak economic number portend a slowdown in the broader economy
news:
Recent economic indicators suggest a slowdown in India's economic growth, raising concerns about the future of the country's economic performance. 

**Key indicators showing weakness:**

* **Capital expenditure:** Central government's capital expenditure dropped 30% year-on-year in August and 19.5% in April-August.
* **Core sector:** Core sector output contracted by 1.8% year-on-year in August, the worst performance in 42 months.
* **Manufacturing and Services PMI:** While remaining in expansionary territory, the manufacturing and services PMI figures for September fell to eight and ten-month lows respectively.
* **GST Collections:** Last month's GST collections grew by only 6.5%, the weakest pace since June 2021.
* **Automobile Sales:**  Overall automobile retail sales declined 9.3% year-on-year in September, with commercial vehicle sales falling for the fourth consecutive month.
* **Air cargo traffic:** Contracted for the second consecutive month.
* **Vaahan registrations:** Fell for the first time in 11 months.

**Expert forecasts and potential implications:**

* **MOFSL:** Estimates GDP growth may have fallen to 6.0-6.5% in July-September, potentially lower than the 6.7% recorded in April-June.
* **Nomura:** "Softer growth signals are visible." 
* **RBI:** May potentially lower its FY25 growth forecast from the current 7.2% due to these weakening signals.

**Government acknowledges concerns:** 

The finance ministry has noted "incipient signs of strains in certain sectors" and  highlighted the slowdown in fast-moving consumer goods sales in urban areas and a fall in state capital expenditure.

These trends suggest that the Indian economy may be heading for a period of slower growth, requiring close monitoring and potential policy adjustments to address these emerging challenges.

title: Zomato CEO: "Swiggy Kicked Me Out" of Shark Tank, Recalls $35 Million Low
description: The Zomato chief also touched on his company’s rivalry with Swiggy, recalling the moment in 2018 when Swiggy raised $1 billion in a funding round while Zomato was sitting on just $35 million in the bank.
news:
Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal will not be returning as a judge on the upcoming season of Shark Tank India. He blames his absence on a sponsorship deal between the show and his main competitor, Swiggy. 

Goyal, a popular judge in the previous season, said he was "kicked out" due to the Swiggy sponsorship. He explained that he had joined the show to provide realistic insights into the startup world, but the sponsorship deal prevents him from returning.  

The Zomato chief also reflected on the rivalry with Swiggy, recalling a particularly challenging moment in 2018. During that year, Swiggy raised $1 billion in funding while Zomato struggled with just $35 million in the bank. Goyal admitted, "That was the only time I thought, 'Oh sh**, we’re dead.'" 

Despite the competitive landscape, Goyal remains pragmatic about Swiggy's growth and upcoming IPO, recently approved by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI). 

While the two companies compete fiercely in the food delivery and quick commerce sectors, both acknowledge the benefits of having each other as strong competitors. Goyal believes that the rivalry pushes them to continuously innovate and improve. 

With Goyal out of Shark Tank and the quick commerce market expanding, the stage is set for an even more intense rivalry between Zomato and Swiggy, not just in food delivery but across the entire Indian tech landscape.

title: Reliance Enters the Quick Commerce Race: Blinkit, Swiggy Instamart and BigBasket on Notice
description: Reliance has already launched pilot programs via JioMart in Navi Mumbai and Bengaluru, signaling its intent to shake up the fast-paced quick commerce market.
news:
Reliance Industries, led by Mukesh Ambani, is reportedly preparing to disrupt the fast-growing quick commerce market in India, targeting major players like Blinkit, Swiggy Instamart, and BigBasket.  

The company has already launched pilot programs through its JioMart platform in Navi Mumbai and Bengaluru, demonstrating its commitment to this sector. Reliance plans to leverage its vast retail network, including Reliance Digital and Trends stores, to fulfill orders, unlike its competitors who rely on dark stores and warehouses.  

The company aims to deliver most orders within 10-15 minutes, utilizing its logistics arm Grab for fulfillment. This strategy allows Reliance to avoid building new infrastructure, distinguishing it from its rivals. 

Furthermore, Reliance plans to offer free delivery, platform fees, and surge charges, placing it at a cost advantage over competitors like Blinkit and Swiggy Instamart. The company aims to expand its service to 1,150 cities across 5,000 pin codes by the end of the month.

This move comes as the quick commerce market experiences rapid growth, with platforms like Blinkit, Zepto, and Swiggy Instamart outperforming traditional FMCG giants like Hindustan Unilever (HUL) and Marico. This competitive landscape highlights the potential of the quick commerce sector to reshape consumer habits. 

Reliance's entry into this market with its aggressive approach is expected to intensify competition, particularly in the fast-moving consumer goods sector, where quick commerce has become a significant growth channel.

title: Middle East Conflict Jitters Market Amid China's Reopening
description: The benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury yield held above 4% in early Asia trade, as a robust U.S. labour market prompted traders to heavily scale back their expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts.
news:
Global markets remain on edge, despite a strong start to China's reopening. While Chinese stocks surged to multi-year highs fueled by optimism over Beijing's stimulus, the Hang Seng Index in Hong Kong tumbled by 3.9%. 

The Middle East conflict, escalating with Hezbollah's rocket attacks on Haifa, is adding to the unease. Concerns over potential oil supply disruptions sent Brent crude futures above $80 a barrel, although they retreated slightly in Asian trading. 

Investors are also reassessing the Federal Reserve's rate cut trajectory after a robust U.S. jobs report. The benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury yield stayed above 4%, reflecting diminished expectations for aggressive rate cuts. 

While China's economic recovery is a positive factor, the combined impact of the Middle East conflict and uncertainty around the Fed's monetary policy stance is keeping investors on high alert.

title: Navigating the Multivitamin Maze: Finding the Right Blend for You
description: How to pick the right multivitamin for your body’s needs  The Washington PostThe ultimate vitamin cheat sheet: Top foods packed with vitamins A to K for better health  The Indian ExpressDo multivitamins work? What supplements actually do  The TimesDoes everyone need to take vitamins — and which are most important? Here’s what to know  AOL
news:
With an abundance of multivitamin options on the market, choosing the right one can feel overwhelming.  This article provides a comprehensive guide to help you make an informed decision. 

**Key Factors to Consider:**

* **Individual Needs:**  A multivitamin tailored to your specific needs is crucial. Consider factors like age, gender, lifestyle, diet, and existing health conditions.  
* **Nutrient Gaps:**  Consult with a healthcare professional to identify any potential nutrient deficiencies in your diet. 
* **Quality and Form:**  Look for reputable brands that adhere to good manufacturing practices and offer forms your body can easily absorb. 
* **Dosage:**  Be mindful of the dosage and ensure it aligns with recommended daily allowances. 

**Remember:** Multivitamins are meant to supplement a healthy diet, not replace it.  Always consult with your healthcare provider before starting any new supplement regimen.

title: New Study Eases Concerns About 'Doomsday' Asteroid Swarm
description: New study eases concerns over possible 'doomsday' asteroid swarm  Phys.org
news:
A new study published in the journal *Nature* has calmed fears of a potential "doomsday" asteroid swarm. Researchers analyzed data from the recently discovered asteroid swarm in the Kuiper Belt, finding that the swarm is far less dense than previously thought. This means the likelihood of a catastrophic impact on Earth is significantly lower than initial estimates. 

The study focused on analyzing the trajectory and composition of the asteroid swarm. The researchers used advanced simulations and sophisticated modeling techniques to determine the swarm's density and potential impact risks. Their findings indicate that the swarm is primarily composed of small, low-mass asteroids that pose little threat to Earth. 

This reassurance is welcome news as the initial discovery of the swarm had sparked concerns about a potential apocalyptic event. While the threat remains, it is now considered significantly less probable, offering a sigh of relief to those worried about the potential dangers of asteroid impacts.

title: "Compounding at 54%? He'll be the richest man in the world soon": Netizens React to Meerut Investor's Matrimonial Ad

news:
A matrimonial ad from Meerut, India, has gone viral after a young investor claimed a 54% annual income growth on his starting salary of Rs 29 lakh (approximately $35,000 USD). The ad, shared on X (formerly Twitter), describes the man as "intellectual, handsome, and smart," emphasizing his financial success.  

The ad's claim of a 54% annual increase in wealth has sparked amusement and skepticism on social media. Many users poked fun at the unrealistic growth, suggesting that the investor would soon be the richest man in the world if his claims are true. Some questioned the safety of his investment strategy, with one user jokingly commenting, "This sounds like an option seller to me!" 

The ad's unique approach, detailing the investor's investment habits, has led to comparisons with a business pitch rather than a traditional matrimonial profile. While some users expressed interest in the investor's "safe investing" PowerPoint presentation, the majority of responses focused on the implausibility of his claimed returns.

title: Taylor Swift Tops Forbes List as Richest Female Musician
description: Currently on her global Eras Tour, Swift's estimated net worth has reached an impressive $1.6 billion, placing her just behind Jay-Z on the Forbes list
news:
Pop star Taylor Swift has surpassed Rihanna to become the world's richest female musician, with an estimated net worth of $1.6 billion. This achievement places her just behind Jay-Z on the Forbes list, making her the first musician to reach billionaire status primarily through their music and performances.

Swift's rise to the top is largely attributed to the phenomenal success of her "Eras Tour," projected to be the highest-grossing concert series in American history, generating an estimated $4.1 billion. Her wealth also stems from royalties, her music catalogue, and real estate holdings, according to Forbes.

Swift's continued global popularity and record-breaking achievements solidify her position as a major force in the music industry.

title: Graduate Cab Driver's Rs 20 Lakh Income Surprises Passenger
description: The woman, who booked a cab through Indrive, conversed with the driver, who disclosed that he and five of his friends, all graduates from corporate and civil engineering backgrounds, turned to driving cabs after struggling to find suitable employment
news:
A young woman in Thane, India, was surprised to learn that her Indrive cab driver had filed an income tax return (ITR) of Rs 20 lakh last year.  The driver, a graduate in civil engineering, revealed that he and five of his friends turned to driving cabs after struggling to find suitable employment. 

The driver's story highlights the potential for success in the cab industry despite the challenges posed by app-based services like Ola and Uber. He owns five WagonRs, which he rents out to other drivers, effectively operating a small business. 

The woman's Reddit post sparked a debate about the realities of income in the taxi industry. While some users questioned the driver's claim, others shared their own experiences with successful cab drivers who had built their own businesses.  The post also prompted discussions about the financial burdens associated with owning and maintaining a fleet of cabs.

title: Delhi's Punjabi Language Debate: Fact or Fiction?
description: Sanskriti Naruka, a Mumbai resident, shared her thoughts on visiting Delhi in an open letter posted on X. She addressed "everyone coming to Delhi" and claimed that anyone who doesn’t speak Punjabi or try to will be seen as an outsider. In her post, she wrote, "Delhi belongs to Punjabis, period."
news:
A recent social media post by a Mumbai resident, Sanskriti Naruka, ignited a fierce debate about the treatment of non-Punjabi speakers in Delhi. Naruka, in an open letter on X, claimed that those who don't speak Punjabi or make an effort to do so are treated as outsiders in the capital city, even going so far as to say "Delhi belongs to Punjabis, period." 

The post went viral, sparking a flood of comments from users who either agreed or disagreed with her claims.  Many people defended the city's cosmopolitan nature and diverse population, arguing that Naruka's experience may be an isolated incident. Others, however, shared their own experiences of feeling excluded in Delhi due to their language.

Several users asserted that they have lived in Delhi for years and have never encountered discrimination based on language. One user, who has resided in Delhi for 13 years, stated, "Been in Delhi from last 13 years, never faced discrimination, never saw anyone doing discrimination based on language. Delhi dilwalon ki hai" (Delhi belongs to those with big hearts).

However, some users did acknowledge that communication difficulties might exist, but they attributed them to general linguistic barriers, not necessarily a deliberate exclusion of non-Punjabi speakers. 

The controversy highlights a complex issue: the role of language in shaping social interactions and perceptions of belonging in diverse cities like Delhi. It also raises questions about the extent to which individual experiences can be generalized to represent the entire city's attitude.

title: India Confident on Oil Supply Despite Recent Price Spikes
description: Despite a 13 per cent spurt in Brent crude prices in last seven days, petrol and diesel prices in India are unlikely to rise as analysts see both Israel and Iran pulling back from the brink.
news:
India's Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has assured the nation that there is no anticipated shortage of crude oil supply, despite a recent 13% surge in Brent crude prices. This surge was triggered by heightened tensions between Israel and Iran, leading to fears of potential disruptions to oil production and supply.

While India currently imports 88% of its oil needs from 39 countries, making it vulnerable to market fluctuations, the government remains optimistic. Minister Puri points to the current global oil surplus and the availability of alternative suppliers.

Experts, however, warn of potential disruptions if tensions escalate. A full-blown conflict could see Iran block the Strait of Hormuz, a critical oil shipping route, leading to severe supply disruptions and price hikes.

However, analysts believe both Israel and Iran are unlikely to escalate the situation into an all-out war due to the significant consequences. The recent price spike is attributed to heightened tensions and is expected to stabilize in the coming weeks.

Further contributing to the calming of the market, the Indian basket of crude oil has shown a steady decline since April, with prices averaging $78.27 per barrel in August. This, along with the expected stabilization of Brent prices, suggests that petrol and diesel prices in India will remain unchanged.

title: Retail Inflation Poised to Rise in September
description: Vegetables remain pricey, core inflation seen to be on the rise
news:
India's retail inflation, after dropping below 4% for two consecutive months in July and August, is expected to climb back up to 5% in September. This is driven by several factors:

* **High Vegetable Prices:**  Continued high vegetable prices are a key contributor.  The cost of a home-cooked vegetable thali has risen by 11% year-on-year, with onions, potatoes, and tomatoes experiencing significant price hikes due to supply chain disruptions.
* **Rising Core Inflation:** Core inflation, which excludes volatile food and fuel prices, is also predicted to rise. This is attributed to increased rural demand, festive season spending, and elevated gold prices.
* **Seasonal Factors:** While vegetable prices usually see a downward trend in the second half of the year due to fresh harvests, disruptions in supply and weather factors have led to price spikes.

Analysts expect the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) to maintain its repo rate at 6.5% for the tenth consecutive meeting, despite concerns about inflation. While the RBI's stance on inflation seems to be softening, they remain cautious about potential spillovers to core inflation. 

Official data on CPI inflation for September will be released on October 14.

title: Nestle India's Longtime Leader to Retire, Amazon Veteran Takes Helm
description: Narayanan has been with Nestle for over 26 years, playing a pivotal role in the company’s growth and navigating significant challenges. He took charge as managing director in 2015, a period marked by the Maggi noodles crisis.
news:
Suresh Narayanan, a veteran of Nestle India for over 26 years, will retire as Chairman and Managing Director on July 31, 2025.  He will be succeeded by Manish Tiwary, currently the Country Leader at Amazon India, who will take over on August 1, 2025. 

Narayanan, known for navigating the company through the 2015 Maggi noodles crisis,  has held a pivotal role in Nestle India's growth.  He led the company through a period of significant challenges and  successfully revived the Maggi brand after a nationwide ban.

Tiwary, with nearly three decades of experience in the e-commerce and consumer goods sectors, joins Nestle India after a successful tenure at Amazon India since 2016.  Prior to that, he spent 20 years at Unilever.  His expertise and experience in navigating the rapidly evolving consumer landscape will be crucial for Nestle India's future. 

Narayanan's legacy includes stabilizing and growing the business, cementing Nestle India's leadership in the FMCG industry.  Tiwary's appointment signifies a new chapter for the company as it continues to build upon Narayanan's foundation while adapting to a changing market.

title: Webb Telescope Reveals Carbon Dioxide on Pluto's Moon Charon
description: Webb telescope discovers carbon dioxide on Pluto's moon at edge of Solar System  India TodayJames Webb Space Telescope detects carbon dioxide and hydrogen peroxide on Pluto’s largest moon Charon; k  The Times of IndiaJames Webb Space Telescope deciphers the origins of Pluto's icy moon Charon  Space.comDetection of carbon dioxide and hydrogen peroxide on the stratified surface of Charon with JWST  Nature.comNASA's Webb Telescope Detects Carbon Dioxide On Surface Of Pluto's Largest Moon Charon  NDTV
news:
The James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) has made a groundbreaking discovery: carbon dioxide and hydrogen peroxide have been detected on Pluto's largest moon, Charon. This finding, published in the journal Nature, sheds light on the composition and evolution of this icy world at the edge of our solar system. 

The JWST's advanced infrared capabilities allowed scientists to analyze the surface of Charon, revealing the presence of these key molecules. The discovery of carbon dioxide suggests a complex history for Charon, possibly involving volcanic activity or the outgassing of volatile compounds. The presence of hydrogen peroxide indicates the potential for chemical reactions triggered by solar radiation, leading to the formation of even more complex molecules.

This discovery marks a significant step forward in understanding the diverse range of planetary bodies in our solar system, emphasizing the unique role of the JWST in unlocking the secrets of our cosmic neighborhood.

title: Double Down on iPhone Security: Setting Up a Passcode
description: iPhone की सिक्योरिटी करनी है डबल तो सेट करें पासकोड, स्टेप बाय स्टेप तरीका  दैनिक जागरण (Dainik Jagran)
news:
**Dainik Jagran**

Want to bolster your iPhone's security? Setting up a passcode is a crucial first step. Here's a simple guide:

1. **Open Settings:** Locate the "Settings" app on your iPhone.
2. **Navigate to "Face ID & Passcode" or "Touch ID & Passcode":** Depending on your iPhone model, you'll find this option under "Security & Privacy" or directly in the Settings menu.
3. **Tap "Set Up Passcode":**  You'll be prompted to enter a 6-digit passcode.
4. **Confirm the Passcode:** Re-enter the same passcode to confirm. 
5. **Optional: Enable "Require Passcode Immediately":**  This setting ensures your passcode is required immediately after the device is locked, providing an additional layer of security.

By following these steps, you'll effectively enhance your iPhone's security by adding a passcode lock.

title: SpaceX Cleared for Launch of Hera Asteroid Probe on Monday
description: US FAA authorizes SpaceX Falcon 9 vehicle for Monday flight  The Indian ExpressSpaceX will launch Europe's Hera asteroid probe on Oct. 7: Watch it live  Space.comAsteroid saga continues: Mission to probe 'crime scene' on Dimorphos ready for blast off  WIONEuropean Space Agency launches mission to study asteroid deflected by NASA  The Times of IndiaEuropean Space Agency to send spacecraft past Mars for 'crime scene investigation'  The Economic Times
news:
The US Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has given the green light for SpaceX to launch the European Space Agency's (ESA) Hera asteroid probe on Monday, October 7th. The launch will take place from Cape Canaveral, Florida, and will be broadcast live on Space.com. 

Hera is a mission designed to study the aftermath of NASA's DART mission, which successfully impacted the asteroid Dimorphos in September 2022. Hera will arrive at Dimorphos in 2026 to investigate the crater left by DART and gather crucial data on the asteroid's composition and structure. 

This mission represents a significant step forward in our understanding of asteroids and the potential risks they pose to Earth.

title: Bengaluru's Footpaths: A Hazard to Pedestrians, Not a "Smart City" Feature
description: In the video, a software professional in Bengaluru compared walking in the city to an extreme sport after a close call last week. He narrowly avoided falling and getting injured while trying to board a bus at the Konanakunte bus stop near Forum South Mall.
news:
A software engineer in Bengaluru has gone viral after highlighting the city's dangerous footpaths in a video. The video, posted on X (formerly Twitter), shows broken pavements, rainwater-filled drains, and debris scattered on the road. 

Yogeesh Prabhuswamy Gandige, the engineer, compared walking in Bengaluru to an extreme sport. He narrowly avoided an injury at the Konanakunte bus stop near Forum South Mall, where he witnessed other commuters precariously standing on drains. 

"One slip could mean a serious injury – that's how pedestrians are treated in this so-called ‘Infra Era’!" Gandige lamented in his post, which has received significant attention on social media. 

Many users on X echoed his concerns, highlighting the shoddy quality of even new infrastructure. Some pointed out that the drain structures were part of Bengaluru's "smart city" rainwater sponge project, further fueling criticism of the project's execution. 

This incident underscores the city's ongoing struggle with poor infrastructure and the dangers it poses to pedestrians. While officials claim to be building a "smart city," the reality on the ground paints a different picture.

title: Ola CEO and Comedian Clash on Twitter Over EV Service Issues
description: The argument began when Kamra posted an image showing a large number of EV scooters at an Ola service center, questioning the company's customer service.
news:
Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal and comedian Kunal Kamra engaged in a heated exchange on Twitter over issues with Ola Electric's S1 series of electric scooters. The dispute began when Kamra posted an image of numerous scooters at an Ola service center, questioning the company's customer service. 

Kamra's post sparked a wave of responses, including criticism of Ola's service and a statement from Kamra that Aggarwal had no reply to the concerns. Aggarwal responded by accusing Kamra of posting a "paid tweet" and challenged him to help solve the issues, even offering to pay him more than his "failed comedy career." 

Kamra denied being paid, challenged Aggarwal to prove his claim, and urged Aggarwal to offer refunds to dissatisfied customers. Aggarwal maintained that Ola has existing programs for customers facing delays and questioned Kamra's sincerity. 

The exchange comes at a time of declining sales for Ola Electric, with the company experiencing its lowest monthly sales in September. Customers have reported issues with malfunctioning hardware and software in the S1 series, further fueling the controversy.

title: James Webb Telescope Reveals Clues to Planet Formation
description: Winds of change: James Webb Space Telescope reveals elusive details in young star systems  University of Arizona NewsThe nested morphology of disk winds from young stars revealed by JWST/NIRSpec observations  Nature.comJames Webb Space Telescope reveals evidence of winds that could solve mystery of how planet-forming disks are shaped  Clemson News
news:
The James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) has made a groundbreaking discovery: evidence of powerful winds emanating from young stars. These winds, observed using the telescope's Near-Infrared Spectrograph (NIRSpec), are shaping the disks of gas and dust surrounding these stars, providing crucial insights into how planets form.

The study, published in Nature, reveals a complex structure within these winds, hinting at a previously unknown interaction between the stellar winds and the surrounding disk. This newfound understanding of the interplay between these elements could be key to unraveling the mystery of how planet-forming disks develop their unique shapes.

The research team, led by scientists from the University of Arizona and Clemson University, highlights the significance of JWST's capabilities in capturing these elusive details, allowing for a deeper understanding of the processes shaping the early stages of planetary systems.

title: 188-Year-Old Man Rescued in Bengaluru? Viral Video Debunked
description: The 24-second video shows two men helping an elderly man with a white beard who is hunched over and using a walking stick. While the video went viral, the remarkable claim about the man's age was met with skepticism from fact-checkers and social media platforms.
news:
A video claiming to show a 188-year-old man rescued from a cave near Bengaluru went viral on social media, accumulating over 34 million views on X. The video, which shows two men assisting an elderly man with a white beard and a walking stick, was met with skepticism from fact-checkers. 

Investigations revealed the man in the video is not 188 years old but Siyaram Baba, a Hindu saint from Madhya Pradesh, who is around 110 years old. Fact-checking organizations, including D-Intent Data, confirmed this, noting that the video and age claim are misleading. 

The viral post on X was flagged with a disclaimer, stating that the man is Siyaram Baba and approximately 110 years old.  News reports from July 2024, including one from Navbharat Times, also confirmed Siyaram Baba's identity and age. 

Despite the video's popularity, the 188-year-old claim has been debunked. Experts have warned of the increasing trend of influencers sharing exaggerated and unverified content for attention.  D-Intent Data urged users to be wary of such claims, highlighting the manipulative tactics used by some influencers to gain social media visibility.

title: Post-Intimacy Hygiene: Why It Matters
description: संबंध बनाने के बाद तुरंत करें ये काम, वरना हो सकती है गंभीर बीमारी  India News Haryana
news:
While this article is about hygiene after sexual activity, it appears to lack the information needed to write a proper article. It's important to rely on accurate, verified information from reliable sources like medical professionals. 

**Here's why post-intimacy hygiene is important:**

* **Preventing infections:**  Urinary tract infections (UTIs) and sexually transmitted infections (STIs) can be spread through sexual contact. Proper hygiene can reduce the risk.
* **Maintaining overall health:**  Keeping the genitals clean and free from bacteria can contribute to overall health and well-being.

**General hygiene tips after sexual activity:**

* **Urinate:** This helps flush out any bacteria that may have entered the urethra.
* **Wash your genitals:** Use mild soap and water to clean the area gently.
* **Wipe from front to back:**  This helps prevent bacteria from the anus from entering the vagina.
* **Change your underwear:**  Wearing clean underwear can help keep the area dry and prevent irritation.

**Important Note:** 

* **This is not medical advice.** Always consult with a healthcare professional for specific advice tailored to your needs.
* **Use protection:** Condoms help prevent the spread of STIs and unplanned pregnancies.
* **If you have any concerns about your health, please reach out to a doctor.**

news: Earth has had two moons in the past, with one returning for a visit every 27 years. This "mini-moon," a small asteroid, is officially being tracked by NASA. title: India's Forex Reserves Hit Record High, Reaching $705 Billion
description: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has emphasized the importance of maintaining a forex buffer to protect the economy during periods of market volatility.
news:
India's foreign exchange reserves have surpassed $700 billion for the first time, reaching a record $705 billion in the week ending September 27th. This surge, fueled by foreign investment in Indian stocks and bonds, makes India's reserves the fourth largest in the world. 

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has actively utilized these reserves to stabilize the rupee, preventing extreme fluctuations amid a near-record low. This strategic move provides the RBI with greater leverage to manage the rupee's performance, with analysts predicting reserves could reach $745 billion by March 2026. 

The buildup in reserves is supported by a balance-of-payments surplus and a narrowing current-account deficit. RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has emphasized the importance of maintaining this forex buffer to protect the economy from market volatility.

Despite the positive developments, global tensions, particularly in the Middle East, pose risks to India's economy. Rising oil prices due to the conflict could disrupt oil supply and influence global interest rate decisions. While the Indian economy shows resilience, external risks and inflationary pressures remain. 

The RBI is expected to approach future policy decisions cautiously, monitoring food and fuel prices closely as inflation continues to decline.

title: Agra Teacher Dies After Heart Attack Following Scam Call About Daughter's Arrest
description: The caller threatened to release an inappropriate video of her daughter if she didn't pay Rs. 1 lakh. Malti then told her son about the situation, asking him to transfer the money quickly to protect her daughter from being implicated in the case.
news:
A tragic incident unfolded in Agra, India, where a school teacher, Malti Verma, died of a heart attack after receiving a scam call about her daughter's alleged involvement in a sex racket. 

The caller, posing as a police officer, threatened to release inappropriate footage of the daughter unless the family paid Rs. 1 lakh. The panicked teacher immediately contacted her son, Divyanshu, urging him to transfer the money.

Divyanshu, however, became suspicious after discovering the caller's number had a Pakistani prefix (+92). He confirmed his sister's safety and reassured his mother, but the distress had already taken a toll on her health.

Upon returning home from school, Malti Verma fell ill and was rushed to a nearby hospital, where she was declared dead on arrival. The incident has highlighted the increasing problem of "digital arrest" scams, with cybercriminals using fear tactics to extort money.

Authorities are investigating the call and will take action against the perpetrator.

title: Fugitive Preacher Zakir Naik Sparks Outrage with 'Get Girls Married' Comment at Orphanage
description: Zakir Naik met with Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Thursday after arriving in the country on Monday.
news:
Controversial Islamic preacher Zakir Naik has sparked outrage after a video surfaced of him abruptly leaving an orphanage for girls in Pakistan. In the video, Naik, who is wanted in India on charges of terror-related activities, refuses to accept flowers and a memento from the girls, citing Islamic principles that he believes prevent him from interacting with them.

According to sources, Naik, who is in Pakistan on a lecture tour, became visibly angry after the orphanage administrator referred to the girls as "daughters." He argued that the girls, deemed to be of marriageable age, should not be called "daughters" and should instead be married off as soon as possible.

This incident has further fueled criticism of Naik's controversial views and his presence in Pakistan, a country that has been vocal in its condemnation of extremism and violence.  India has strongly condemned Naik's visit, calling it "disappointing and condemnable," while Malaysia, where Naik has been residing since fleeing India, has indicated its willingness to cooperate with Indian authorities if sufficient evidence is presented against him.

title: Wegovy Weight Loss: The Science and Hype of Supplements
description: Wegovy Weight Loss: The Science and The Hype of Supplements  FrontlineOzempic is transforming your gym  Financial TimesREGENCEN  Harbor LightSome patients are microdosing Ozempic without medical advice: Report | NewsNation Live  NewsNation NowUnapproved: Doctor advises against Ozempic for weight loss  WOODTV.com
news:
The buzz surrounding Wegovy (semaglutide) for weight loss is undeniable.  But amidst the hype, separating science from marketing is crucial. 

**The Science:**

Wegovy, a GLP-1 receptor agonist, is FDA-approved for chronic weight management in adults with obesity. Clinical trials show significant weight loss (up to 15%) compared to placebo.  It works by mimicking the effects of a naturally occurring hormone that regulates appetite and glucose levels.

**The Hype:**

While effective, Wegovy isn't a magic bullet.  Concerns about potential side effects like nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea, along with high cost and limited availability, fuel the hype.  

**The Unverified:**

Reports of people "microdosing" Ozempic (a similar medication) for weight loss without medical advice are alarming. Doctors warn against this practice, emphasizing the importance of personalized treatment plans.

**The Bottom Line:**

Wegovy holds promise for those struggling with obesity, but understanding its limitations and potential risks is crucial.  Always consult with your doctor before considering any weight-loss medication.

The chawl, a traditional type of tenement housing often associated with lower-income families, features a small living room, bedroom, kitchen, and a loft for storage.

title: India's Capex Set for Revival, Driven by Housing and Power Sectors
description: Revival in housing construction, power generation would drive India’s capex in the next few years, new investment areas to do their bit in adding to growth, said Axis Capital report.
news:
A new report from Axis Capital forecasts a resurgence in India's capital expenditure (capex) over the next six years, driven primarily by the revival of the housing construction and power generation sectors. 

While both sectors have experienced a downturn in recent years, the report suggests they will be the foundation of a renewed investment cycle. 

The report highlights that new investment areas, such as green hydrogen, defense, solar modules, robotics, data centers, and energy storage, will also contribute to the growth in the investment ratio, adding 60-80 basis points.  

Axis Capital also predicts that demand for capital goods will rise due to robust manufacturing growth and a decrease in import dependency. 

However, the report acknowledges challenges to capex revival, including slower global demand, China's overcapacity, and reduced foreign capital inflow. 

Despite a recent increase in India's growth forecasts, the report suggests that trend-growth expectations are unlikely to surpass 7-7.5 percent due to these factors. 

The report also recommends specific stocks that are likely to benefit most from the capex rebound, with L&T, Adani Ports, ABB, Container Corporation, Craftsman Auto, CESC, and Hindalco among the top "Buy" recommendations. Conversely, Bharat Electron, BHEL, Torrent Power, JSW Steel, Tata Steel, and SAIL are listed as top "Sell" suggestions.

news:
Nissan has officially launched the 2024 Magnite facelift in India. The updated subcompact SUV boasts a refreshed design, enhanced features, and a competitive price point.  

Key highlights of the Magnite facelift include:

* **Refreshed Exterior:** The updated model features a new front grille, redesigned headlights, revised bumper, and updated alloy wheels.
* **Interior Upgrades:**  The interior sees new upholstery, a redesigned dashboard, and potentially updated technology features.
* **Enhanced Features:**  Expect the facelift to include new safety features, improved connectivity, and possibly additional driver assistance systems.
* **Competitive Pricing:**  Nissan aims to maintain the Magnite's competitive pricing, making it a compelling option in the highly competitive subcompact SUV segment.

Further details regarding specifications and pricing are expected to be released soon. The Magnite facelift is set to challenge established players in the Indian market and capture a larger share of the segment.

title: The Zyber 365 Mystery: India's Fastest Unicorn or a Fabricated Success Story?
description: The founder, Pearl Kapur, had claimed the start-up is a Unicorn, based on a $100 million fund-raise from a London-based investor. That investor had also announced an investment in SpiceXpress, but it turns out that it never materialised
news:
Zyber 365, a Web 3.0 AI company founded by Pearl Kapur, claimed unicorn status in July 2023, based on a $100 million Series A funding round. This claim garnered significant attention, particularly given the company's young age, having been incorporated just weeks prior. 

However, despite initial media buzz, inconsistencies and unanswered questions have emerged surrounding the company's alleged funding. Notably, a parallel claim of $100 million investment by SRAM & MRAM Group in SpiceXpress, the cargo division of SpiceJet, has been debunked. A SpiceJet spokesperson confirmed that no such investment has materialized.

Adding to the mystery, Zyber 365's co-founder Sunny Piyushkumar Vaghela resigned this year, citing lack of progress on product development, funding, and strategic implementation.  Vaghela's resignation letter also requests removal of his name and TechDefence's address from the company's website.

Despite claiming to be a leading multinational conglomerate, Zyber 365's website offers little concrete information about its operations. Moreover, no financial reports have been filed with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs since the company's incorporation.

While Kapur maintains a strong social media presence, he has not responded to inquiries regarding the funding claims. Similarly, SRAM & MRAM Group has not responded to requests for comment.

The lack of transparency and inconsistencies surrounding Zyber 365's alleged funding raise serious questions about the validity of its claimed unicorn status. The situation highlights the importance of due diligence and critical analysis when evaluating startup claims, particularly in a rapidly evolving industry like Web 3.0.

title: India Poised for Steepest Rise in Living Standards: Finance Minister
description: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated in her address that India is seeking to double its per capita income in a matter of a few years for its population of 1.4 billion people.
news:
Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has declared that the upcoming decades will mark a period of unprecedented economic growth and rising living standards for India.  In her address at the Kautilya Economic Conclave, she stated that the country aims to double its per capita income within a few years, impacting its population of 1.4 billion.

Sitharaman highlighted that the economic reforms implemented in the past decade are beginning to show significant results, with a decline in inequality evidenced by the Gini coefficient.  This positive trend is expected to continue, with the Covid-19 shock gradually receding from the economy. 

Despite these optimistic predictions, the minister acknowledged the potential challenges posed by global conflicts and the impact of emerging technologies on the labor market.  She emphasized the need for India to address the potential social and economic disruptions caused by technological advancements, particularly given its large youth population. 

The Finance Minister remains confident in India's ability to navigate these challenges.  She sees a surge in consumption fueled by a growing middle class and a young population entering the consumer market.  She believes this will attract foreign investment and contribute to a vibrant marketplace.

title: India's Economy: A Bright Future, but Don't Forget the Lessons of 2024
description: Indian economy is set for a positive trajectory over the next 20 years due to favorable demographics. However, investors should remain vigilant against overpricing and external financial influences, particularly from China and global liquidity flows. Learning from past complacency, strategic timing and careful investment will be crucial for sustained growth.
news:
Anurag Singh, Managing Partner of Ansid Capital, sees a bright future for the Indian economy over the next two decades, driven by favorable demographics. He highlights that India's population dynamics will remain advantageous for at least 20 years, a unique position no other country holds.

However, Singh warns against complacency, citing the recent market crash as a reminder that overpricing and external influences can disrupt even the most promising economies. He emphasizes the need for vigilance against:

* **Overpricing:** Recognizing the potential for markets to become overly optimistic, Singh advises investors to exercise caution and avoid blindly chasing returns.
* **External Financial Influences:**  He acknowledges the vulnerability of the Indian market to global liquidity flows and the potential for capital to shift towards China, which recently injected $100 billion into its own market.

Singh stresses the importance of strategic timing and careful investment decisions for sustained growth. He advocates for a more cautious approach, replacing the previously common strategy of "secular buying" with a more active, data-driven investment style.

He also highlights the need for Indian investors to be aware of global trends and analyze their own markets independently, rather than solely relying on the movements of foreign institutional investors (FIIs). 

The article concludes with a reminder that while the Indian economy is poised for strong growth, investors must learn from the recent market correction and prioritize vigilance, thoughtful investment, and a long-term perspective.

title: "Wealth isn't the issue, it's how it's used": Harsh Goenka Responds to Nithin Kamath's View on Indian Wealth Resentment
description: Kamath had said that India's socialist roots still heavily influence its attitudes toward wealth, even as the country grows economically. “We are all socialists,” he added.
news:
RPG Enterprises Chairman, Harsh Goenka, has challenged Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath's recent assertion that India's socialist roots lead to widespread resentment towards wealth. Goenka argues that Indians celebrate billionaires like Ratan Tata, Azim Premji, and Anand Mahindra, who are admired for their humility and philanthropy. 

Goenka, in a post on X, stated that the issue lies not with wealth itself, but with how it is used. He criticizes individuals who flaunt their wealth, engage in corrupt practices, and prioritize personal gain over societal good. 

Kamath, speaking at TechSparks 2024, suggested that India's deeply ingrained socialist mindset fuels suspicion of wealth. He acknowledged the persistence of wealth inequality in the country, expressing doubt about a shift in this mindset anytime soon. 

The exchange between Kamath and Goenka has sparked a wider conversation about Indian attitudes toward wealth. Some online commentators pointed out that in certain regions like Bengaluru, wealthy individuals tend to maintain a low profile. Others reflected on India's cultural values, with one user suggesting that poverty is viewed as a badge of honor.

Recent reports of a car accident involving Pakistani cricketer Musharraf Khan have brought the issue of car safety ratings into the spotlight.  While the details of the accident are unclear, the incident has prompted discussion about the safety features of the vehicle involved and whether a higher safety rating could have prevented or mitigated the impact of the crash. 

Consumers are encouraged to research the safety ratings of cars before making a purchase. Organizations like the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) in the US and Euro NCAP in Europe provide comprehensive safety ratings for vehicles based on rigorous testing.

title: Ratan Tata Sells Upstox Stake After 23,000% Return
description: The Ratan Tata and Tiger Global-backed digital investment and trading platform said Tata’s stake in Upstox has registered a whopping 23,000% return on the original investment made in 2016, based on its last round valuation of $3.5 billion.
news:
Indian business icon Ratan Tata has sold a 5% stake in the digital investment platform Upstox, generating a staggering 23,000% return on his initial investment. Tata originally invested $200,000 in 2016 for a 1.33% stake in the company.  Upstox, valued at $3.5 billion after its latest funding round, has significantly increased the value of Tata's initial investment to $46.55 million. 

Upstox co-founder Kavitha Subramanian highlighted the significance of Tata's early belief in the company and his vision for making wealth management accessible to all Indians.  The company has expanded its offerings to include insurance and aims to become a comprehensive wealth management platform.

Upstox's financial performance in the last fiscal year saw an EBITDA of Rs 200 crore and a consolidated net profit of Rs 25 crore.  Broking revenue surpassed Rs 1,000 crore, a 44% increase from the previous year.  The company also generated over Rs 200 crore in cash during the last two quarters of FY23.

title: Indian Managers' Nosey Behavior Towards Sick Leave Sparks Reddit Debate
description: On Reddit, one user, under the handle "pranagrapher," sparked a conversation in the "Indiasocial" community, asking fellow Indians to share stories about their managers’ responses when they took sick days. The replies poured in, revealing a mix of both heartbreaking and humorous encounters
news:
A Reddit thread in the "Indiasocial" community has highlighted the often intrusive and inappropriate responses Indian employees face when taking sick leave. The thread, initiated by user "pranagrapher," garnered over 5,700 upvotes and countless comments detailing various encounters with overly inquisitive managers. 

Many responses described managers questioning the legitimacy of illnesses, even going so far as to suggest alternative medications.  One user recounted being asked by their manager if they could postpone menstrual leave due to a heavy workload, while another was accused of faking a 102° fever.  Another user was asked to provide medical documents after using company insurance for dengue treatment, while another was told to take sick leave before it "lapsed" the following year. 

The thread's discussion reflects a larger issue of employers questioning employee's genuine need for sick leave, leading to a culture of fear and pressure to work while ill. This issue is particularly prevalent in India, where work-life balance and employee well-being are often overlooked. The thread serves as a reminder of the importance of respecting employees' health and privacy, and the need for employers to implement more supportive and understanding sick leave policies.

title: Google's Gemini AI Voice Feature Now Free for All Android Users
description: Google’s Gemini AI Voice Feature Now Available For Free To Android Users: What It Is And How It Works  News18Google rolls out Gemini Live voice chat feature to all Android users: How to use  Business TodayGoogle brings Pixel 9’s Gemini AI features to all Android phones: All the details  MoneycontrolGoogle rolls out Gemini Live with 10 new voices for free users on Android: Technology news  Business StandardThis Google Pixel 9 Gemini AI feature is now available for all Android users for free  The Times of India
news:
Google has made its Gemini AI voice feature available for free to all Android users. This feature, previously exclusive to Pixel 9 phones, allows users to interact with their device using natural language voice commands. 

Gemini AI is a powerful language model that can understand and respond to complex requests, making it more natural and intuitive to use than traditional voice assistants.  This means you can ask it to  set reminders, write emails, search the web, and even translate languages. 

The feature is now available for free to all Android users through a recent update to the Google app.  You can access Gemini AI by opening the Google app and tapping the microphone icon.

title: Electric Vehicle Sales Surge in India, But Growth Led by Two-Wheelers
description: 6 महीने में इलेक्ट्रिक व्हीकल्स की बिक्री 25% बढ़ी: कुल 8 लाख वाहन बिके, ई-कारों में 1.3% की ही बढ़ोतरी हुई  Dainik Bhaskarत्योहारी सीजन से पहले भारत में दोपहिया वाहनों की बिक्री में तेजी; विशेषज्ञ ने कहा- अक्टूबर में होगी असली परीक्षा &nbsp...
news:
Electric vehicle sales in India have seen a significant increase in the first six months of the year, rising by 25% compared to the same period last year. A total of 800,000 electric vehicles were sold, with two-wheelers contributing the most to this growth.  

While the overall EV market saw a healthy jump, electric car sales only increased by a modest 1.3%. This suggests that the growth is primarily driven by the increasing popularity of electric two-wheelers.

Experts believe the upcoming festive season will be crucial in determining the future trajectory of the EV market. They anticipate a surge in demand, with the true impact of the recent growth becoming clearer in October.

title: 'Gandi Baat' Fame Actress Anveshi Jain Faces Body Shaming: 'People Told My Father, See What Your Daughter Is Doing'

news:
Anveshi Jain, known for her role in the web series 'Gandi Baat', has opened up about facing body shaming from her own brother. In an interview, she revealed he had said, "You are famous because of your body, not your talent." 

She also shared how her father was subjected to inappropriate comments from strangers.  "People would tell my father, 'See what your daughter is doing'," Jain stated.

Jain's experiences highlight the pervasive nature of body shaming and the negative impact it can have on individuals, even those in the public eye.

title: Bharat Forge Subsidiary to Manufacture Howitzers with US Companies
description: Kalyani Strategic Systems to sign pacts with two US companies for manufacture of 105-mm and 155-mm howitzers.
news:
Bharat Forge's subsidiary, Kalyani Strategic Systems, has announced a partnership with two US defense companies, AM General and Mandus Group, to manufacture 105-mm and 155-mm howitzers. 

This collaboration aims to develop next-generation artillery platforms designed for modern warfare, featuring enhanced firepower, precision, mobility, and command & control capabilities. The new howitzers will be lightweight, modular, and highly transportable, offering both firepower and agility. 

The partnership highlights the growing demand for advanced artillery systems in the evolving global combat landscape.  Both AM General and Mandus Group bring specialized expertise in vehicle engineering and artillery solutions, respectively, making this a strategic collaboration for the development of innovative weapon systems.

title: Former RBI Governor Warns Against Ignoring Food Inflation
description: Food prices are a major factor in India’s inflation dynamics, with nearly half of the Consumer Price Index (CPI) basket dedicated to food.
news:
Raghuram Rajan, former Governor of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), has expressed concern over the potential exclusion of food prices from inflation calculations. He argues that doing so would erode public trust in the central bank's ability to manage inflation effectively. 

Rajan highlights the significant impact of food prices on Indian households, which constitute nearly half of the Consumer Price Index (CPI) basket. He emphasizes that while the RBI may not be able to influence short-term food price fluctuations, sustained food inflation indicates underlying structural issues requiring the central bank's attention.

This cautionary note comes amidst ongoing discussions about recalibrating the CPI basket to reflect modern consumption patterns and the potential to reduce the weight of food prices. While some argue that excluding food inflation from benchmark interest rate considerations is justified due to its volatility and limited control by monetary policy, Rajan maintains that food inflation cannot be dismissed.

His concern stems from the potential for a disconnect between official inflation figures and the reality of rising food prices, leading to a loss of public confidence in the central bank's statements. Rajan draws parallels to past periods when the RBI focused on the Producer Price Index (PPI) – a measure that failed to resonate with public experiences of inflation. 

The article underscores the crucial role of food inflation in India's inflation dynamics, particularly in comparison to developed countries where its impact is less pronounced. The RBI faces the challenge of balancing food and core inflation to maintain public trust in its inflation management strategy.

title: Stem Cell Breakthrough: Type 1 Diabetes Reversed in China, But More Research Needed
description: Cure Within Reach But More Studies Needed: Indian Experts on World’s First Stem Cell Reversal of Type 1 Dia  News18Chinese scientists make history by reversing woman’s Type 1 diabetes: ‘I can eat sugar now’  The Indian ExpressIn groundbreaking, world-first achievement, Type 1 diabetes cured in China using stem cell transplant, rep  The Economic TimesChinese scientists see sweet success, reverse type-1 diabetes in woman using her own stem cells  ThePrint
news:
Chinese scientists have achieved a groundbreaking milestone, successfully reversing Type 1 diabetes in a woman using her own stem cells.  This is the first reported case of its kind worldwide, with the patient now able to consume sugar without experiencing complications.

While this development offers hope for millions suffering from Type 1 diabetes, Indian experts caution that further research is crucial. The long-term efficacy and safety of this treatment need to be rigorously evaluated through larger clinical trials.  

The success hinges on the potential of stem cell therapy to regenerate the insulin-producing cells in the pancreas, which are destroyed in Type 1 diabetes. This breakthrough opens exciting avenues for future treatment options, but more research is needed to confirm its widespread applicability and ensure patient safety.

title: "Throwing people into a pressure cooker": Zoho CEO warns of toxic work culture in India
description: Vembu's comments come at a time when there has been a spate of incidents wherein young employees lost their lives to excessive work load.
news:
Sridhar Vembu, CEO and co-founder of Zoho, has voiced concern over the toxic work culture prevalent in Indian companies, warning that such an environment is unsustainable in the long run. 

Vembu likened the pressure-cooker environment to "throwing people into a very big pressure cooker," where excessive workloads and unhealthy work-life balance lead to burnout and tragic consequences. He highlighted the recent deaths of young employees due to work stress, citing the cases of Anna Sebastian Perayil who worked for EY, and Tarun Saxena, an employee of Bajaj Finance who died by suicide. 

He emphasized the importance of a balanced work environment, stating that while he himself has worked for 27 years and hopes to continue for another 28, he recognizes the importance of avoiding burnout. Vembu's comments come amidst growing concerns over work-related stress in India.

title: The Vital Role of Oxygen in Global Health: WHO Webinar Highlights Importance
description: Webinar: The crucial rule of oxygen in global health  World Health Organization (WHO)View Full coverage on Google News
news:
The World Health Organization (WHO) recently hosted a webinar emphasizing the crucial role of oxygen in global health. The event, titled "The Crucial Rule of Oxygen in Global Health," highlighted the importance of oxygen access for treating a wide range of health conditions, particularly in low- and middle-income countries. 

While further details of the webinar's content are unavailable due to the limited information provided, it is likely that the WHO discussed topics such as:

* **Oxygen's essential role in treating respiratory illnesses:** This includes conditions like pneumonia, COVID-19, and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).
* **Challenges in ensuring equitable access to oxygen:**  Many regions lack sufficient infrastructure, medical equipment, and trained personnel to provide adequate oxygen therapy.
* **Strategies to strengthen oxygen systems:** The WHO likely addressed the need for investing in oxygen production, distribution, and management, as well as the importance of training healthcare professionals.

The webinar serves as a reminder of the vital role oxygen plays in global health and the urgent need to address disparities in access to this life-saving resource.

title: Desperate Man Robs Bank in Uttar Pradesh, Citing Home Loan Debt
description: After entering the manager's office urgently, he informed him that he owed Rs 38.5 lakh on his home loan. He warned that if he didn't pay the money immediately, his house would be sold at auction
news:
A man armed with a firearm robbed an Axis Bank branch in Shamli, Uttar Pradesh, making off with ₹40 lakh in broad daylight. The robber, who wore a mask, entered the bank manager's office and claimed he owed ₹38.5 lakh on his home loan, warning that his house would be sold at auction if he didn't get the money. He also threatened suicide, saying he needed the funds to save his family from homelessness. 

The manager, Naveen Jain, directed his cashier to fulfill the robber's demands under duress. After obtaining the cash, the robber fled on a motorcycle. Police are investigating the incident, examining CCTV footage and questioning bank staff.

title: No More Anti-Profiteering Cases Under GST After April 1, 2025
description: The principal bench of the GSTAT will hear ongoing anti profiteering complaints, taking over from the Competition Commission of India.
news:
The Indian government has announced that no new anti-profiteering cases will be accepted under the Goods and Services Tax (GST) after April 1, 2025. This decision, following a recommendation by the GST Council, aims to streamline the GST framework and reduce the burden on the Competition Commission of India (CCI). 

While no new cases will be taken, ongoing anti-profiteering complaints will be transferred to the principal bench of the GST Appellate Tribunal (GSTAT) for resolution.  The GSTAT, with its expertise in tax matters, is expected to provide more efficient adjudication of these cases.

This change provides businesses with greater flexibility in pricing goods and services, as they will no longer be subject to the anti-profiteering regulations under GST. However, businesses must still ensure that they pass on the benefits of reduced tax rates or input tax credits to consumers in the form of lower prices.

title: Apple Accused of Illegal Workplace Rules by US Labor Board
description: The complaint accuses Apple of "interfering with, restraining, and coercing employees in the exercise of" their rights under federal labor law.
news:
The National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) has filed a complaint against Apple, alleging the tech giant has violated employee rights to organize and advocate for better working conditions.  The complaint, announced Monday, claims Apple imposed unlawful workplace rules, including:

* **Confidentiality, non-disclosure, and non-compete agreements:** These agreements, according to the NLRB, restrict employees' ability to discuss workplace issues like pay equity and discrimination.
* **Overly broad misconduct and social media policies:** The complaint argues these policies discourage employees from engaging in protected activity.

The NLRB alleges Apple's actions "interfere with, restrain, and coerce employees in the exercise of" their rights under federal labor law. 

Apple has denied wrongdoing, stating it "has always respected its employees' rights to discuss wages, hours and working conditions." The company plans to contest the allegations at a hearing scheduled for January. 

The complaint stems from charges filed in 2021 by Ashley Gjovik, a former Apple employee who claimed the company retaliated against her for organizing workers and filing NLRB complaints. Gjovik's lawsuit against Apple was largely dismissed this week.

This case is part of a broader trend of increased unionization efforts at Apple stores nationwide. Two Apple stores have successfully unionized since 2022, and several others are currently organizing.

title: Zero Brokerage Plans Face Demise as Regulatory Changes Hike Transaction Fees
description: Angel One, India's third-largest brokerage by client count, introduced a flat fee of ₹20 or 0.1% of turnover (whichever is lower) on cash market transactions starting November 1, anticipating a drop in revenues from the derivative segment. Previously, these transactions were free of charge.
news:
India's third-largest brokerage, Angel One, has announced a flat fee of ₹20 or 0.1% of turnover (whichever is lower) for cash market transactions starting November 1st. This move, prompted by anticipated revenue decline from the derivative segment, signifies a shift away from zero-brokerage models.

The new fee structure comes as regulatory changes, including measures to curb derivative market frenzy, increase transaction costs and potentially lower trading volumes. Industry experts believe that the increased costs will make it difficult for brokerages, especially discount platforms, to maintain their current fee structures.

This shift is driven by a recent Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) directive mandating uniform transaction levies for brokers and customers.  This regulation could reduce brokerage income by ₹2,000 crore, significantly impacting discount platforms that heavily rely on derivative market revenue.

While Zerodha, another prominent brokerage, has yet to announce a fee change, its founder Nithin Kamath has acknowledged the potential for a significant revenue hit due to stricter derivative trading rules.

The move signals an end to the era of free or heavily discounted brokerage services, forcing a reevaluation of pricing models by both large and small brokerage firms.
